channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Building waste materials dumped all over the grass, 7th September
item.description:
Building waste materials dumped all over the grass , please see photos

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual dumping of waste, 7th September
item.description:
Waste from neighbouring buildings, including possibly from restaurant premises is being continually dumped by the bin that is overflowing on a weekly basis. This is unsightly, upsetting to witness daily and risks attracting vermin.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 instances of graffiti near 44 The Avenue, 7th September
item.description:
There is some graffiti on a comms box on the south side of The Avenue between No 44 The Avenue and the eastern side of Apex Close. There is also some graffiti on a yellow brick wall between the aforementioned comms box and the junction of Apex Close and The Avenue. Please can they be removed.....thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual overflowing bin and fly tipping, 7th September
item.description:
It seems that residents from Clarence Mansions are continually leaving their recycling bags out throughout the week and not on the designated Wednesday pick up day. Added to this the bin is continually overflowing with rubbish and now attracts fly tipping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kenilworth Rd and Hazelmere Rd pedestrianised area, 7th September
item.description:
Above areas in desperate need of cleaning: beer/cider cans, dumped clothes, pizza boxes, dog faeces and general litter everywhere. Disgusting!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This tree in Laurel Close seems dead as large branches keep breaking in high winds and as they above a pathway can fall and injure someone passing under .Route used by Parents taking kids to Birbeck School, 7th September
item.description:
Tree seems dead , as in windy conditions large branches are breaking and falling onto pathway which is used by pedestrians.If landing on someone can cause serious injury, big broken branches are stuck in canopy awaiting chance to fall .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langford Place, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge protruding onto pavement, 7th September
item.description:

item.title: Dog walker on my mums driveway allowing his dog to poop, 7th September
item.description:
My mum is an elderly woman, nearly 90 years old, she has had over the years, found dog mess on her driveway. She has had to remove, clean the dog poop, she suffers from a back back and legs, it puts a lot of strain on my mum.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinnacle Hill, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
